custom_device.name: Name
custom_device.info_main_capability: Activate this option to add an entity as main capability. Switch will be added as onoff capability including quick action for the device tile. Power entity will be added as measure_power capability to enable measurement in Homey energy.
custom_device.info_converter: You can add a JavaScript function to convert the parameter value and return a converted/calculated value that should be set as capability value of the Homey device. Use the correct data type. Example for simple calculation (value) => { return value * 100; } This uses the 100x of the HA value as capability value. Example for date conversion from ISO to local date: (value) => { return new Date(value).toLocaleString('de-DE', {timeZone: 'Europe/Berlin', hour12s: false, hour: '2-digit', minute: '2-digit', day: '2-digit', month: '2-digit', year: 'numeric' }); } Replace 'de-DE' with your locale.
custom_device.info_capability: The device capability is preassigned after entity selection. If the capability can not be determined correctly, you can set a custom target capability. Alternatively you can adjust the preassigned capability name. You can use capability names like measure_*, meter_*, alarm_*, onoff, onoff_button or button. Or select one capability from the autocomplete list. When using a capability name more than once in a device, use subcapabilities instead like onoff.livingroom.
custom_device.info_entity: Select an entity from the list to add the entity state as device capability. If you want to add an entity attribute instead, you can activate this checkbox and select the attribute of the selected entity. You can insert an attribute manually, too. Examples for entity weather.home: Simple attribute: temperature Array: forecast[0].temperature Select a corresponding capability (possibly including a sub capability) if a numeric or alphanumeric capability is not the right one and the attribute is representing e.g. a temperature or a binary sensor/alarm.
custom_device.info_number_input:
A numeric input entity (number or input_number) is usually imported as a sensor.

If the value of this entity is to be changed in Homey, the entity can be represented as a slider.
The properties of the entity (min, max, increment) are taken over.

Use the slider to change the value - also in the HA entity.
custom_device.info_decimals: Set the number of decimal places for numeric capabilities. This overrides the default value of the entity.
